subject: How to create a suite of test cases that share states?
msgSnippet: I create a suite of test cases in one class: public class MyTest extends TestCase { public Shared sharedState; protected void setUp() {...} protected void
messageBody:
I create a suite of test cases in one class:

public class MyTest extends TestCase {
public Shared sharedState;
protected void setUp() {...}
protected void tearDown() {...}
public void test1() {...}
public void test2() {...}

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest( new MyTest("test1"));
suite.addTest( new MyTest("test2"));
}
}

The test cases have a shared state. One minor problem is setUp() and tearDown()
are called multiple times. A bigger problem is two instances of MyTest are
created in suite(), make sharing state impossible. I am trying to make the
sharedState static. Is there a more elegant way in JUnit?

JUnit seems to be designed to run each test case as a fresh instance with 0
dependency amount each other. This doesn't work for me. I need to have them run
as a series of test cases with shared state. Any suggestion?

wai yip
